content_clusters.consolidation_notes: Article 19674849725329 covers approval workflow and transaction tracking. PRD 2738323648 adds undo/reject capability for transaction processors. Navigation entry confirms Transactions as related page.
Article 14241863915665 covers creation and configuration of payroll file templates for processing and reporting, including field mapping and custom field creation.
Article 14242822167441 covers employee-facing payroll history and payslip download. PRD 1280671819 extends with multi-currency payslip generation in employee base currency.
Articles 14244247551889 and 14244306427025 cover two distinct payroll processing methods via Lulu Exchange: cash deposit and check deposit, each with specific steps and constraints.
Article 14244169734033 covers trade license upload for payroll processing, including Lulu Exchange and WPS integration requirements.

Article 23328113412625 provides high-level overview of entire payroll processing workflow. PRD 1234534409 is stub but referenced as v1 Payroll management 2.0. Navigation entry confirms Run Payroll as primary entry point.

Core payroll processing workflow: submitting transactions, managing unpaid amounts, and closing months. PRD 1280671819 enriches with multi-currency transaction handling. PRD 2738323648 adds transaction rejection capability. Consolidated into two tasks: one for transaction submission and one for month closure with carry-forward logic.

Specialized workflow for setting up deduction policies tied to attendance violations. Covers policy creation, penalty configuration, and employee assignment. Distinct from simple deduction categories (CLU-011) due to complex violation tracking and approval workflows.
Reporting and analysis capabilities for payroll data. Covers variable pay reports, reimbursement breakdowns, and time-off analytics. Finance Manager and HR Admin personas use this for insights.
External payment processing via wire transfer through Lulu Exchange. Covers banking integration, fund transfer, and confirmation workflow. Finance Manager persona executes this process.

Article provides foundational payroll workflow overview (salary calculations, expenses, payments). PRD 1234534409 is a stub with no additional detail. Multi-currency PRD enriches with currency-aware validation rules and constraints.

Grouped payroll reporting and data visibility issues: paid/unpaid aggregation, office column export, multi-table management, Lulu transaction tracking, and future hire date handling. Mix of Won't Do and Setup stage.

Grouped nine expense/financial visibility issues: paginated views, filtered downloads, settled transaction views, payee filtering, balance widgets, unified screens, transaction detail access, incomplete transactions, and expense overview metrics. All status Done.
Single ticket on Time and Pay Adjustments filtering. Status Backlog, affects Reporting stage.
Grouped two technical backend issues: redundant API calls and project management workflow confusion. Both Won't Do status with minimal user-facing impact.
Grouped tickets addressing inability to view, list, search, or filter transactions across banking, ledger, card, and expense contexts. All reflect gaps in transaction discovery and access.
Grouped tickets requiring unified views of transactions by state (Incomplete, Rejected, Approved, Added to Payroll). All lack consolidated filtering and expense type differentiation.
Single ticket addressing lack of Excel bulk upload for variable pay, forcing manual data entry inefficiencies.
Single ticket addressing missing credit note creation for vendors, limiting payable adjustment tracking.

product_context.title: PRD: Multiple currency with new payroll table and the submit flow
product_context.why_built: UAE companies with overseas employees (sales teams abroad, remote hires for cost/talent reasons) currently manage non-AED payroll in Excel, causing human errors, lack of system of record, and unmanaged audit trails. This feature enables companies to manage payroll data and expenses for employees earning in non-AED currencies within the same system, eliminating parallel Excel processes. This is the most requested payroll feature per sales reports.
key_design_decisions: Currency field added to salary configuration with searchable dropdown supporting all currencies (default AED)
Payroll table redesigned with currency tabs for multi-currency view
Strict validation prevents mid-month currency changes when any pay items exist (paid or unpaid)
Currency change updates all amounts in salary configuration automatically
Payslips generated in employee base currency
Expenses support non-AED requests and reimbursements
Recurring deductions validated for currency compatibility with future months
Approved expenses must be moved back to pending before currency change
Submit flow updated to handle currency-specific transactions (separate submission per currency)
Variable pay and adjustments are currency-aware
Searchable currency dropdown displays 'Currency Code - Currency Name' format

product_context.title: PRD: Reject transactions
product_context.why_built: Enable transaction processors to undo/reject custom cycle payroll transactions directly from the platform, replacing the need for admin panel access. This improves user experience and reduces dependency on backend support for transaction corrections.
key_design_decisions: Undo button added to transaction interface for direct rejection without admin panel
Rejection reason field is optional but captured for audit trail
Automatic email notifications sent to relevant parties upon rejection
Only custom cycle transactions in open months can be undone
Audit trail records who undid transaction and who originally submitted
Generic error message displayed if undo fails, directing users to support
Close payroll month action cannot be undone from platform
Optional rejection reason field allows processors to document why transaction was undone
Rejection notifications sent to relevant parties (original submitter, approvers)
Restrictions maintained: only open month transactions, custom cycle only, transaction processor role required

product_context.title: v1 PRD: Payroll management 2.0
product_context.why_built: To provide a comprehensive online payroll management system that enables companies to manage the entire payroll process including salary calculations, expense management, and salary payments without relying on external tools or manual processes.
key_design_decisions: Modular payroll process allowing users to adopt all or specific parts based on internal company processes
Support for partial payroll closure (all employees, groups, or specific components)
Integration with Lulu Exchange for salary payments and WPS for compliance file generation

detected_integrations.description: Payroll transactions integrate with Lulu Exchange for salary payouts via cash deposit, check deposit, and SIF file processing. Trade license registration required for Lulu Exchange payroll processing.
Payroll transactions can be processed through SAB system as alternative to Lulu Exchange for salary disbursement.
Payroll processing supports WPS integration with Freezone Authority Account number requirement for specific payroll processing workflows.
Payroll table allows navigation to employee profiles, and salary configuration is managed through employee compensation module. Multi-currency settings stored in employee profile.
Sends automated warning emails for attendance violations. Sends rejection notifications when transactions are undone. Notifies relevant parties of payroll status changes.
Payroll transactions tracked and managed through Finance > Transactions page. Transaction status, approvals, and rejections managed through this interface.
Check deposit payroll processing integrates with multiple bank systems for check deposit and fund transfer. Payroll file templates support integration with banking systems for transaction processing.
Payroll file templates support integration with government reporting systems like DEWS for compliance and reporting.
Payroll file templates can create and map custom fields if standard fields are insufficient for payroll processing requirements.

Integrated to automatically adjust payroll based on time off and violations. Deduction policies use attendance data to trigger salary deductions for violations. Attendance violations can trigger automatic payroll adjustments.

Tracks and processes work-related expenses and mileage reimbursements. Expenses are included in payroll processing and can be carried forward to next month if unpaid. Approved expenses must be resolved before currency changes.
Payroll transactions require approval before payment processing. Deduction policies require approval of violation entries. Additions and deductions must be approved before payroll processing.
Handles currency-specific transactions and payroll processing. Payroll table displays currency tabs. Transactions submitted per currency. Payslips generated in employee base currency.
Manages open vs. closed payroll months. Transactions can only be undone in open months. Closing payroll month is permanent and cannot be reversed.
Extended with currency field and validation logic for multi-currency support. Currency changes trigger validation of all pay items and expense approvals.
Transactions can be added to payroll; users lack consolidated view of 'Added to Payroll' state. Variable pay bulk upload not supported, forcing manual entry.
Bank transaction syncing via LeanTech connection; users cannot sync bank transactions directly from Banking tab without established connection.
Time off and payroll adjustments require filtering and categorization in processed adjustments section
Future hire date handling and employee status management in payroll table configuration
Card transaction visibility and details depend on data received from Simplifipay; cardholder cannot view past transactions or update missing transaction information.
Wallet balance, top-up, and unload fund actions lack direct CTAs from transaction and expense screens; users cannot quickly access fund management from transaction contexts.
Credit note creation for vendors not supported; limits payable adjustment tracking and vendor account management.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The payroll table has limited interaction points and navigation flexibility. Users can only click the employee name to access details (not the entire row), cannot customize column visibility, and lack flexible scrolling/drag navigation across different devices. This creates friction in daily payroll data access and reduces usability on smaller screens or with non-trackpad inputs.

The payroll system cannot aggregate paid and unpaid items in a unified view, lacks office-level details in exports, and does not support multi-table management for complex compensation structures. Reporting is fragmented across multiple backend components (company tables, excel exports, transaction records), limiting comprehensive payroll insights.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Lulu Exchange & Future Hire Date Handling
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The payroll system lacks comprehensive transaction tracking for Lulu exchange house transactions, preventing visibility into funds transfer mode changes and initial transaction statuses. Additionally, the system does not robustly handle employees with future hire dates, creating complexity in managing employee status and payroll configurations.

The banking module lacks comprehensive search and filtering capabilities for AR Managers. Users cannot search unassigned or assigned transactions by transaction description or customer name, lack a dedicated consolidated view for assigned transactions, and cannot perform bulk customer assignments. These limitations force manual transaction-by-transaction processing and reduce efficiency in managing large transaction volumes.

The expense and financial management screens lack unified visibility and comprehensive filtering. Users cannot see all company expenses in paginated recent card transaction views, cannot download filtered transaction subsets, lack consolidated views of settled/incomplete transactions, cannot filter by payee, and do not have unified balance widgets (Available Balance, Pending Settlement, Current Balance) across Expense Transactions, Wallet Top-Up, and Ledger screens. Additionally, transaction detail access requires navigation away from the dashboard, and incomplete card transactions are not visible to admins on mobile.

The Time and Pay Adjustments Processed section lacks detailed filtering capabilities to distinguish between time off and payroll processed entries. Users can only view approved entries without clear categorization, limiting their ability to analyze and report on specific adjustment types.

The payroll table payload retrieval involves redundant API calls to fetch unfiltered totals, representing technical inefficiency in frontend data retrieval. Additionally, project management workflow confusion exists around parent-child ticket status synchronization.

Users cannot easily discover, view, or filter transactions across multiple contexts (banking, ledger, card, expense). The platform lacks search/filter capabilities by cardholder, card name, expense category, or date range. Bank transaction syncing, ledger listing, and card activity viewing are either unavailable or incomplete, restricting users' ability to locate and analyze specific transactions.

The platform does not provide unified views of transactions grouped by state (Incomplete, Rejected, Approved, Added to Payroll). Users cannot see all transactions in a given state across both work expenses and corporate card transactions in one place. Missing columns for expense type differentiation and receipt headers further complicate transaction management and action-taking.

The Expense overview page lacks intuitive navigation and quick-access CTAs. Users cannot directly access detailed transaction views, top-up history, or ledger pages from the overview. Wallet fund actions (top-up, unload) are not clickable from transaction screens. The 'Recent card transactions' section displays too many items, causing important information and CTAs to be pushed below the fold. Key financial metrics (wallet balance, active cards, pending transactions) are not aggregated on the overview page.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Variable Pay Bulk Upload Not Supported
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The payroll module does not support Excel bulk upload for variable pay data. Users must manually enter variable pay information for each active payroll month, creating inefficiencies and increasing data entry errors.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Vendor Credit Note Creation Not Available
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform does not support creating credit notes for vendors, limiting users' ability to track and manage payable adjustments. This gap impacts procurement and finance workflows that rely on accurate vendor account management.
